title: 108_hr3784
content: The Act is titled the "Taxpayer Rebate and Responsibility Act" and includes a section on refunding budget surplus amounts under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Taxpayer Rebate and Responsibility Act" includes a provision for eligible individuals to receive a refund against the tax imposed by chapter 1, based on their allocable portion of the refund amount or limitation amount for the taxable year. The Secretary is required to refund or credit any overpayment promptly. The term 'surplus year' is defined as a fiscal year certified by the Director of the Office of Management and Budget to have a surplus in the United States budget, excluding certain trust funds. The term 'refund amount' is defined as the applicable percentage of the surplus certified for a surplus year, with the percentage determined by the Secretary not less than 50 percent and not more than 100 percent. The taxpayer's allocable portion of the refund amount is determined by the Secretary based on the ratio of the tax paid by the taxpayer for their first taxable year to the total taxes imposed on all eligible individuals. The limitation amount for any taxable year is the excess of the regular tax liability for that year. The text discusses the calculation of tax refunds and credits for a taxable year, with special rules including no interest on overpayments and specific treatment for joint returns.
